revision.text:
{{Wired embedded system |brand=Asecam |model=B8IPC-4KPOE |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |type=IP camera |pwr_v=12 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_poe=af |cpu1_brand=Fullhan |cpu1_model=FH8856V100 |fla1=8 |fla1_brand=BoyaMicro |fla1_model=BY25Q64ES |ram1=128 |ram1_model=embedded |serial=yes,, 3-pin header,, (115200,8,N,1) |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip2_brand=JLSemi |eth_chip2_model=JL1101 |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=1 |stock_boot=U-Boot;2010.06 |stock_os=Linux;3.0.8 |flags=PoE in, microphone |default_ip=192.168.1.10 |default_user=admin |default_pass=123456 |oui_eth=F6:3A:80 }} {{TagLine|Asecam B8IPC-4KPOE 8MP POE IP Camera}} ===Overview=== This camera is based on a [[Vatilon]] PB1 module. It appears that Asecam is merely a white-label brand, and did not make any modifications to the Vatilon hardware or software. ===Specifications=== * IP Camera :Processor: [[Fullhan]] FH8856V100 :Image sensor: [[GalaxyCore]] GC4653 4MP 1/3" (Vatilon says it's a GC8053, but both OpenIPC's {{code | ipctool }} and examination of the stock firmware indicate that it's a GC4653.) :Memory: 128MB embedded RAM; 8MB SPI NOR flash (BoyaMicro BY25Q64ES) :Video: 8MP H.265 (HEVC) or H.264 (Despite the apparent 4MP sensor, the encoder does produce a 3840x2160 video stream.) :LAN: [[JLSemi]] JL1101 FE (10/100) :Ports: 1x FE (RJ45) PoE ===Links=== *[https://www.aliexpress.com/item/3256802624432191.html Asecam product listing] *[https://www.vatilon.com/productinfo/1634907.html Vatilon PB1 module product page] *[https://www.vatilon.com/ipcrjxz Vatilon software downloads] *[https://www.mediafire.com/folder/s0c52sgrda5i1/ Asecam software downloads] *[https://pdf4pro.com/view/1-3-4mega-cmos-image-sensor-datasheet-7a89fa.html GalaxyCore GC4653 datasheet] *[http://www.main-soul.com/catalog/IC/Ethernet_IC/JLSEMI_JL11x1-v1.11.pdf JLSemi JL11x1 datasheet] ===Bootlog=== {{SCollapse|Bootlog â€¢ >> |
